CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 28, 1962, pg. 12 reads: "Seagram Salesman Bob French has just finished explaining to Terrace Hall Hotel owner Louis Harrington why Seagram's Seven Crown is the top-selling brand in the nation, with Seagram's V.O. running second. Bob also states that Seagram's Golden Gin is expected to have a banner year because hosts and hostesses are making it an all-year-around drink."
TitMainTitle: Hotel owner Louis Harrington and Seagram Representative Robert "Bob" P. French Jr., standing in bar of Terrace Hall Hotel
